sentences: Sembiin Gonchigsumlaa (Mongolian: Сэмбийн Гончигсумлаа; 1915-1991) was a Mongolian composer, generally considered to have been one of the greatest contributors to modern Mongolian national music and classical music.
He is credited with being the first to write Mongolian ballet music.
He was also a Merited Artiste and Chairman of the Composers' Union.
Symphonic poem about the Mongolian People's Revolutionary Party, 1955
Symphony No. 3 (in memory of G. Dmitrov),  1982
Symphony No. 5 (in memory of E. Telman), 1988
24 Preludes for Piano, 1978 and 1979Gonchigsumlaa also composed more than 200 compositions for piano based on folk songs and his own themes.
